definition: big gun/cannon/artillery/one who talks big/trad. form 大炮 also used/CL:門|门[men2],尊[zun1]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating
to talk big/to shoot one's mouth off
cannon fire to hit a mosquito/to use a sledgehammer to crack a nut

sentences.english: The new battleship will be armed with 16-inch guns.
sentences.chinese: 那艘战舰将装备16英寸口径的大炮。

sentences.english: Today the Iraqi artillery attacked the Al-Fao port.
sentences.chinese: 今天，伊拉克大炮攻击了法奥港。

sentences.english: He ordered all the port cannon to be heaved to starboard to counteract the list.
sentences.chinese: 他命令把左弦上所有的大炮移到右舷以抵消船的倾斜。

sentences.english: Second shot came when I was stupefied by the cannon's omnipotent, pervasive power.
sentences.chinese: 第二杆打在我的大炮的万能的，普遍的权力惊呆了。

sentences.english: The soldiers dismounted a gun from the guncarriage.
sentences.chinese: 战士们从炮车上卸下大炮。

sentences.english: Pinchgut is now a museum for cannon and antique mat è riel.
sentences.chinese: 品奇各特现在是大炮和旧时军用装备博物馆。

sentences.english: The new battle-ships will be armed with 16-inch guns.
sentences.chinese: 这种新战列舰将装上16英寸口径的大炮。

sentences.english: A cannon that can be fired at a high elevation for relatively short ranges.
sentences.chinese: 一种能在相对近的射程内高角度射击的大炮。

sentences.english: Cannons and carronades were turned from brass rods.
sentences.chinese: 大炮和大口径短炮是用黄铜棒旋制的。

sentences.english: Both sides engaged in artillery and heavy-machinegun fire.
sentences.chinese: 双方均动用了大炮与重型机枪。

sentences.english: They did their best to harl the cannon over the hill.
sentences.chinese: 他们拼力把大炮拖过了山顶。

sentences.english: This boxing is the king of Shaolin Boxing .
sentences.chinese: 少林大炮捶，可以说是少林拳中的王者。

sentences.english: There are some cannoneers nearly as noisy as their own guns.
sentences.chinese: 有些炮手的嗓门几乎跟他们的大炮一样响。

sentences.english: The new battleship shall be armed with 16-inch guns.
sentences.chinese: 新战舰将以16英寸口径的大炮武装起来。

sentences.english: Here they had omitted the cannons.
A company of infantry of the line had come up and occupied the end of the street behind the piece of ordnance.
sentences.chinese: 一连作战的步兵来占领街的尽头，在大炮的后面。

definition: to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating
firearms (in historical context)/flintlock (old powder and shot firearm)
Western (or Western-style) cannon of the Ming era
